title: Andromalius
data:
**Andromalius, the Repentant Rogue** is a [spirit](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Ritual, seal and taboo](#Ritual.2C_seal_and_taboo)

- [2 Mark](#Mark)

- [3 Benefits](#Benefits)

- [4 As a monster](#As_a_monster)

  - [4.1 Generation](#Generation)
  - [4.2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Ritual, seal and taboo

Andromalius's seal must contain any two of the following sets of items - in exchange for successfully binding him, the two objects will be removed from the game, with a third different item from the list generated in their place:

- a [sack](/wiki/Sack "Sack")
- a [universal key](/index.php?title=Universal_key\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Universal key (page does not exist)")
- a [ring](/wiki/Ring "Ring") with a [randomized appearance](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") that is made of [gold](/wiki/Gold_\(material\) "Gold (material)")
- a [coin](/wiki/Coin "Coin")
- a [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger")
- an [apple](/wiki/Apple "Apple")
- a [scroll](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll")
- a [tin whistle](/wiki/Tin_whistle "Tin whistle")
- a [mirror](/wiki/Mirror "Mirror")
- an [egg](/wiki/Egg "Egg") of any kind
- a [potion](/wiki/Potion "Potion")
- a [cave spider](/wiki/Cave_spider "Cave spider") [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse")
- a corpse of your own [race](/wiki/Race "Race")
- a corpse of any [elf](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)"), [elf](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)"), [dwarf](/wiki/Dwarf_\(monster_attribute\) "Dwarf (monster attribute)"), [gnome](/wiki/Gnome_\(monster_attribute\) "Gnome (monster attribute)"), [orc](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_attribute\) "Orc (monster attribute)"), [hobbit](/wiki/Hobbit "Hobbit"), [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)"), or a primate (i.e. [monkey](/wiki/Monkey "Monkey"), [ape](/wiki/Ape "Ape"), [yeti](/wiki/Yeti "Yeti"), [carnivorous ape](/wiki/Carnivorous_ape "Carnivorous ape"), or [sasquatch](/wiki/Sasquatch "Sasquatch"))
- a [spellbook](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook")
- a [bell](/wiki/Bell "Bell")
- a set of [lock picks](/wiki/Lock_pick "Lock pick")
- a live [sewer rat](/wiki/Sewer_rat "Sewer rat") ([tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame") if given by Andromalius)

To remain bound to Andromalius, a character must not steal directly from a [shop](/wiki/Shop "Shop") or use any item considered stolen (including the [Binder](/wiki/Binder "Binder") starting inventory).

## Mark

A character bound to Andromalius has their facial features take on the rigidity of a bad disguise. Their odd face will not be noticed from a distance, and they can wear a [mask](/wiki/Mask_\(dNetHack\) "Mask (dNetHack)") or stay out of lit squares to disguise it.

## Benefits

While Andromalius is bound, he grants skill in [daggers](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") and protects a character from any form of theft attack: this include seduction-based theft, e.g. from [nymphs](/wiki/Nymph_\(monster_class\) "Nymph (monster class)") and similar monsters, but not other types of seduction that do not normally steal items, e.g. from [foocubi](/wiki/Foocubi "Foocubi").

Andromalius's active powers are as follows:

- **Jester's Mirth**: Immobilize a single adjacent monster with laughter, subject to a [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") check. A monster that passes the check will be frozen for 1 turn, and is otherwise immobilized for a duration based on the roll of that character's "spirit die" - this die's size is based on [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") and [rank](/wiki/Rank "Rank") title: a character of XL 3-5 uses a d2, a character of XL 6-9 uses a d3, a character of XL 10-12 uses a d4, etc. While immobile, the target is vulnerable to [sneak attacks](/wiki/Sneak_attack_\(dNetHack\) "Sneak attack (dNetHack)").
- **Thief's Instincts**: Detect hidden doors and traps.

His passive powers are as follows:

- **Detect Thieves**: The character is [warned of monsters with theft attacks](/wiki/Warned_of_monster_type "Warned of monster type").
- **Sneak attack**: The character is capable of sneak attacks as though they were a [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue").
- **Know Stolen**: Any stolen items in the character's inventory are identified as such.

## As a monster

| @ Andromalius *(No tile)*                                       |                                                                                  |
| --------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **[Difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty")** | 16                                                                               |
| **Attacks**                                                     | Weapon 2d4 teleports your gear away, touch 2d4 paralyses, Weapon 2d4 steals item |
|                                                                 |                                                                                  |

| @ Andromalius *(No tile)*                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |                                                                                  |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **[Difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | 16                                                                               |

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |                                                                                  |
| **Base [level](/wiki/Monster_level "Monster level")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | 12                                                                               |
| **Base [experience](/wiki/Experience_points "Experience points")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | 328                                                                              |
| **[Speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              | 12                                                                               |
| **Base [AC](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | 6                                                                                |
| **[Base MR](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | 0                                                                                |
| **[Alignment](/wiki/Alignment#Monster_alignment "Alignment")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | 1 (lawful)                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |                                                                                  |
| **[Frequency](/wiki/Monster_frequency "Monster frequency")** (by [normal means](/wiki/Normal_mechanism "Normal mechanism"))                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   | 0 (Not randomly generated)                                                       |
| **[Genocidable](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  | No                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |                                                                                  |
| **[Weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | 1450                                                                             |
| **[Nutritional value](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | 400                                                                              |
| **[Size](/wiki/Physical_size "Physical size")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | medium                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |                                                                                  |
| Andromalius:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)").
* is male.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless").
* cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming"). |                                                                                  |

In notdNetHack, **Andromalius**, @, also appears as a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that can be summoned by an [Illithanachronounbinder](/wiki/Illithanachronounbinder "Illithanachronounbinder"). He is a [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)") that can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"), and will pick up and collect items.

Andromalius has a weapon attack that teleports away worn armor, a [paralyzing](/wiki/Paralyzing "Paralyzing") touch attack, and a second weapon attack that can steal items.

Like many summoned spirits, Andromalius cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Tame "Tame").

### Generation

Andromalius is first generated when summoned from his seal by an Illithanachronounbinder. He is always created hostile, and is not a valid form for normal [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph").

Andromalius is [generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a [sack](/wiki/Sack "Sack") and a stack of 5-15 daggers.

Andromalius [does not leave a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") upon death.

### Strategy

**Below this point, there are major spoilers for the Illithanachronounbinder role.** They can be accessed by selecting the "Role spoiler" tab.

[x][ ]

- Strategy
- Role spoiler

Andromalius moves at the same speed as an unhasted and unburdened character. In addition to using his daggers in melee and at range, he can also paralyze a character and teleport their armor away, which is a potentially deadly combination even if he cannot also steal items (i.e. from the effects of binding him). Ranged attacks are strongly recommended to deal with him.

If Andromalius is killed after being summoned, he can be encountered again in the [Void](/index.php?title=Void\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Void (page does not exist)"), a branch accessed by opening the high [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") of [Ilsensine the Fallen](/wiki/Ilsensine_the_Fallen "Ilsensine the Fallen") as an Illithanachronounbinder using the [invoke](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") effect of [The Elder Cerebral Fluid](/wiki/The_Elder_Cerebral_Fluid "The Elder Cerebral Fluid"). Andromalius is generated along with many other spirits of the near void on the first floor of the branch, and is generated with the "whispers" template, which makes him [nonliving](/wiki/Nonliving "Nonliving").

## Encyclopedia entry

There is a legend.  
  
Once, there was a rogue, the favorite servant of the Thief God. With his dying breath, the rogue renounced theft, thereby stealing his soul from the God.

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Andromalius

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Andromalius, the Repentant Rogue is a spirit that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack.

Contents

  • 1 Ritual, seal and taboo
  • 2 Mark
  • 3 Benefits
  • 4 As a monster
    • 4.1 Generation
    • 4.2 Strategy
  • 5 Encyclopedia entry

Ritual, seal and taboo

Andromalius's seal must contain any two of the following sets of items - in exchange for successfully binding him, the two objects will be removed from the game, with a third different item from the list generated in their place:

  • a sack
  • a universal key
  • a ring with a randomized appearance that is made of gold
  • a coin
  • a dagger
  • an apple
  • a scroll
  • a tin whistle
  • a mirror
  • an egg of any kind
  • a potion
  • a cave spider corpse
  • a corpse of your own race
  • a corpse of any elf, elf, dwarf, gnome, orc, hobbit, human, or a primate (i.e. monkey, ape, yeti, carnivorous ape, or sasquatch)
  • a spellbook
  • a bell
  • a set of lock picks
  • a live sewer rat (tame if given by Andromalius)

To remain bound to Andromalius, a character must not steal directly from a shop or use any item considered stolen (including the Binder starting inventory).

Mark

A character bound to Andromalius has their facial features take on the rigidity of a bad disguise. Their odd face will not be noticed from a distance, and they can wear a mask or stay out of lit squares to disguise it.

Benefits

While Andromalius is bound, he grants skill in daggers and protects a character from any form of theft attack: this include seduction-based theft, e.g. from nymphs and similar monsters, but not other types of seduction that do not normally steal items, e.g. from foocubi.

Andromalius's active powers are as follows:

  • Jester's Mirth: Immobilize a single adjacent monster with laughter, subject to a MR score check. A monster that passes the check will be frozen for 1 turn, and is otherwise immobilized for a duration based on the roll of that character's "spirit die" - this die's size is based on experience level and rank title: a character of XL 3-5 uses a d2, a character of XL 6-9 uses a d3, a character of XL 10-12 uses a d4, etc. While immobile, the target is vulnerable to sneak attacks.
  • Thief's Instincts: Detect hidden doors and traps.

His passive powers are as follows:

  • Detect Thieves: The character is warned of monsters with theft attacks.
  • Sneak attack: The character is capable of sneak attacks as though they were a Rogue.
  • Know Stolen: Any stolen items in the character's inventory are identified as such.

As a monster

@ Andromalius (No tile)
Difficulty 16
Attacks Weapon 2d4 teleports your gear away, touch 2d4 paralyses, Weapon 2d4 steals item
@ Andromalius (No tile)
Difficulty 16
Attacks

Weapon 2d4 teleports your gear away, touch 2d4 paralyses, Weapon 2d4 steals item

Base level 12
Base experience 328
Speed 12
Base AC 6
Base MR 0
Alignment 1 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size medium

Andromalius:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is male.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • cannot be tamed.

In notdNetHack, Andromalius, @, also appears as a monster that can be summoned by an Illithanachronounbinder. He is a human that can be seen via infravision, and will pick up and collect items.

Andromalius has a weapon attack that teleports away worn armor, a paralyzing touch attack, and a second weapon attack that can steal items.

Like many summoned spirits, Andromalius cannot be tamed.

Generation

Andromalius is first generated when summoned from his seal by an Illithanachronounbinder. He is always created hostile, and is not a valid form for normal polymorph.

Andromalius is generated with a sack and a stack of 5-15 daggers.

Andromalius does not leave a corpse upon death.

Strategy

Below this point, there are major spoilers for the Illithanachronounbinder role. They can be accessed by selecting the "Role spoiler" tab.

Andromalius moves at the same speed as an unhasted and unburdened character. In addition to using his daggers in melee and at range, he can also paralyze a character and teleport their armor away, which is a potentially deadly combination even if he cannot also steal items (i.e. from the effects of binding him). Ranged attacks are strongly recommended to deal with him.

If Andromalius is killed after being summoned, he can be encountered again in the Void, a branch accessed by opening the high altar of Ilsensine the Fallen as an Illithanachronounbinder using the invoke effect of The Elder Cerebral Fluid. Andromalius is generated along with many other spirits of the near void on the first floor of the branch, and is generated with the "whispers" template, which makes him nonliving.

Encyclopedia entry

There is a legend.

Once, there was a rogue, the favorite servant of the Thief God. With his dying breath, the rogue renounced theft, thereby stealing his soul from the God.

'''Andromalius, the Repentant Rogue''' is a [[Spirits (dNetHack)|spirit]] that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]].

==Ritual, seal and taboo==
Andromalius's seal must contain any two of the following sets of items - in exchange for successfully binding him, the two objects will be removed from the game, with a third different item from the list generated in their place:

* a [[sack]]
* a [[universal key]]
* a [[ring]] with a [[randomized appearance]] that is made of [[Gold (material)|gold]]
* a [[coin]]
* a [[dagger]]
* an [[apple]]
* a [[scroll]]
* a [[tin whistle]]
* a [[mirror]]
* an [[egg]] of any kind
* a [[potion]]
* a [[cave spider]] [[corpse]] 
* a corpse of your own [[race]]
* a corpse of any [[Elf (monster attribute)|elf]], [[Elf (monster attribute)|elf]], [[Dwarf (monster attribute)|dwarf]], [[Gnome (monster attribute)|gnome]], [[Orc (monster attribute)|orc]], [[hobbit]], [[Human (monster attribute)|human]], or a primate (i.e. [[monkey]], [[ape]], [[yeti]], [[carnivorous ape]], or [[sasquatch]])
* a [[spellbook]]
* a [[bell]]
* a set of [[lock pick]]s
* a live [[sewer rat]] ([[tame]] if given by Andromalius)

To remain bound to Andromalius, a character must not steal directly from a [[shop]] or use any item considered stolen (including the [[Binder]] starting inventory).

==Mark==
A character bound to Andromalius has their facial features take on the rigidity of a bad disguise. Their odd face will not be noticed from a distance, and they can wear a [[Mask (dNetHack)|mask]] or stay out of lit squares to disguise it.

==Benefits==
While Andromalius is bound, he grants skill in [[dagger]]s and protects a character from any form of theft attack: this include seduction-based theft, e.g. from [[Nymph (monster class)|nymphs]] and similar monsters, but not other types of seduction that do not normally steal items, e.g. from [[foocubi]].

Andromalius's active powers are as follows:

*'''Jester's Mirth''': Immobilize a single adjacent monster with laughter, subject to a [[Magic resistance (monster)|MR score]] check. A monster that passes the check will be frozen for 1 turn, and is otherwise immobilized for a duration based on the roll of that character's "spirit die" - this die's size is based on [[experience level]] and [[rank]] title: a character of XL 3-5 uses a d2, a character of XL 6-9 uses a d3, a character of XL 10-12 uses a d4, etc. While immobile, the target is vulnerable to [[Sneak attack (dNetHack)|sneak attacks]].
*'''Thief's Instincts''': Detect hidden doors and traps.

His passive powers are as follows:

*'''Detect Thieves''': The character is [[Warned of monster type|warned of monsters with theft attacks]].
*'''Sneak attack''': The character is capable of sneak attacks as though they were a [[Rogue]].
*'''Know Stolen''': Any stolen items in the character's inventory are identified as such.

In notdNetHack, '''Andromalius''', {{gray|@}}, also appears as a [[monster]] that can be summoned by an [[Illithanachronounbinder]]. He is a [[Human (monster attribute)|human]] that can be seen via [[infravision]], and will pick up and collect items.

Andromalius has a weapon attack that teleports away worn armor, a [[paralyzing]] touch attack, and a second weapon attack that can steal items.

Like many summoned spirits, Andromalius cannot be [[tame]]d.

===Generation===
Andromalius is first generated when summoned from his seal by an Illithanachronounbinder. He is always created hostile, and is not a valid form for normal [[polymorph]].

Andromalius is [[Monster starting inventory|generated with]] a [[sack]] and a stack of 5-15 daggers.

Andromalius [[Corpseless|does not leave a corpse]] upon death.

In addition to using his daggers in melee and at range, he can also paralyze a character and teleport their armor away, which is a potentially deadly combination even if he cannot also steal items (i.e. from the effects of binding him). Ranged attacks are strongly recommended to deal with him.

If Andromalius is killed after being summoned, he can be encountered again in the [[Void]], a branch accessed by opening the high [[altar]] of [[Ilsensine the Fallen]] as an Illithanachronounbinder using the [[invoke]] effect of [[The Elder Cerebral Fluid]]. Andromalius is generated along with many other spirits of the near void on the first floor of the branch, and is generated with the "whispers" template, which makes him [[nonliving]].
